issues.message: Interactive card should have proper ARIA role and keyboard support
issues.description: Interactive card should have proper ARIA role and keyboard support This code works but could be improved for better maintainability.
issues.suggestion: Add role='button', tabIndex, and keyboard event handlers for proper accessibility

fix.newCode:
<GlassCard
      className={cn(
        "cursor-pointer transition-all",
        checked && "ring-2 ring-primary ring-opacity-50",
      )}
      role="button"
      tabIndex={0}
      onClick={() => onCheckedChange(!checked)}
      onKeyDown={(e) => {
        if (e.key === 'Enter' || e.key === ' ') {
          e.preventDefault();
          onCheckedChange(!checked);
        }
      }}
      interactive
    >

  --glass-border: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.18); /* Subtle white border */
  --glass-shadow: 0 8px 32px rgba(31, 38, 135, 0.37); /* Soft depth shadow */
  --glass-blur: 40px; /* Backdrop blur intensity */

          onClick={() => setIsOpen(false)}

          tabIndex={-1}
          aria-hidden="true"
        />

<div
          className="fixed inset-0 bg-black/50 z-40 lg:hidden"

          tabIndex={-1}
          aria-hidden="true"
        />

issues.message: Missing keyboard interaction documentation for dismissible notifications
issues.description: Missing keyboard interaction documentation for dismissible notifications This code works but could be improved for better maintainability.
issues.suggestion: Document Escape key support for dismissing notifications and focus behavior

fix.newCode:
## Accessibility

- Uses ARIA live regions for screen reader announcements
- Error notifications use `aria-live="assertive"` for immediate announcement
- Info/success notifications use `aria-live="polite"` for non-disruptive announcement
- Keyboard navigation support for action buttons
- Escape key dismisses notification when focused
- Focus management when notification appears
- Focus returns to trigger element when notification is dismissed
- Proper color contrast for all variants
- Screen reader accessible close button with descriptive label
fix.description: Document Escape key support for dismissing notifications and focus behavior
fix.content:
## Accessibility

- Uses ARIA live regions for screen reader announcements
- Error notifications use `aria-live="assertive"` for immediate announcement
- Info/success notifications use `aria-live="polite"` for non-disruptive announcement
- Keyboard navigation support for action buttons
- Escape key dismisses notification when focused
- Focus management when notification appears
- Focus returns to trigger element when notification is dismissed
- Proper color contrast for all variants
- Screen reader accessible close button with descriptive label

| ----------- | --------------------------------------------------------------- | -------- | -------- | ------------------------------ |
| `title`     | `string`                                                        | -        | Yes      | Notification title             |
| `message`   | `string`                                                        | -        | Yes      | Notification message           |
| `type`      | `"success" \| "warning" \| "error" \| "info"`                   | `"info"` | No       | Notification type              |
| `autoHide`  | `boolean`                                                       | `false`  | No       | Auto-hide after duration       |
| `duration`  | `number`                                                        | `5000`   | No       | Duration before auto-hide (ms) |
| `actions`   | `Array<{label: string, onClick: () => void, variant?: string}>` | -        | No       | Action buttons                 |
| `onClose`   | `() => void`                                                    | -        | No       | Close callback                 |
| `className` | `string`                                                        | -        | No       | Additional CSS classes         |

// Mock performance monitor since the module was removed
const performanceMonitor = {
  startMeasure: (name: string) => ({ name, startTime: performance.now() }),
  endMeasure: (measurement: any) => performance.now() - measurement.startTime,
  recordMetric: (name: string, value: number) =>
    console.debug(`Metric ${name}: ${value}ms`),
  getMetrics: () => ({}),
  trackComponent: (name: string, data: any) =>
    console.debug(`Component ${name}:`, data),
  startTiming: (name: string) => ({ name, startTime: performance.now() }),
  endTiming: (name: string) => console.debug(`Timing ${name} completed`),
  trackCustomMetric: (name: string, value: number) =>
    console.debug(`Custom metric ${name}: ${value}`),
  init: (options: any) => console.debug('Performance monitor initialized', options),
};

issues.suggestion: Add aria-label and role attributes to skeleton elements for better accessibility

fix.newCode:
<motion.div
          ref={itemRef}
          className={cn(skeletonVariants({ variant, size, shape }), className)}
          style={skeletonStyle}
          role="progressbar"
          aria-label="Loading content"
          aria-busy="true"
          initial={animated ? { opacity: 0.4 } : false}
          animate={
            animated
              ? variant === "pulse"
                ? pulseAnimation
                : { opacity: [0.4, 0.8, 0.4] }
              : false
          }
          transition={
            animated
              ? {
                  duration: 1.5,
                  repeat: Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY,
                  ease: "easeInOut",
                  delay: index * 0.1,
                }
              : undefined
          }
        >

issues.message: Search input missing aria-expanded attribute for dropdown state
issues.description: Search input missing aria-expanded attribute for dropdown state This code works but could be improved for better maintainability.
issues.suggestion: Add aria-expanded, aria-haspopup, and aria-controls attributes to indicate dropdown state

fix.newCode:
<input
          ref={inputRef}
          type="text"
          value={query}
          onChange={(e) => {
            setQuery(e.target.value);
            setIsOpen(true);
            setSelectedIndex(-1);
          }}
          onFocus={() => setIsOpen(true)}
          onKeyDown={(e) => {
            if (e.key === "Enter") {
              e.preventDefault();
              handleSearch();
            }
          }}
          placeholder={placeholder}
          aria-expanded={isOpen}
          aria-haspopup="listbox"
          aria-controls="search-dropdown"
          aria-activedescendant={selectedIndex >= 0 ? `search-option-${selectedIndex}` : undefined}
          role="combobox"
          className={cn(
            "w-full rounded-xl border py-3 pr-10 pl-10",
            getGlassClass("default"),
            focusRing,
            "text-[var(--text-primary)] placeholder:text-[var(--text-secondary)]",
            "border-[var(--liquid-glass-border)] focus:border-[var(--liquid-glass-border-focus)]",
            microInteraction.gentle,
          )}
        />

issues.message: Button component lacks proper ARIA attributes for loading state
issues.description: Button component lacks proper ARIA attributes for loading state This code works but could be improved for better maintainability.
issues.suggestion: Add aria-label or aria-describedby for loading state and aria-disabled when loading

fix.newCode:
<Comp
        className={cn(
          baseClasses,
          variantClasses[variant],
          sizeClasses[size],
          isPressed && "scale-95",
          className,
        )}
        ref={ref}
        disabled={disabled || loading}
        aria-disabled={disabled || loading}
        aria-label={loading ? `Loading... ${children}` : undefined}
        onTouchStart={() => setIsPressed(true)}
        onTouchEnd={() => setIsPressed(false)}
        onMouseDown={() => !isMobile && setIsPressed(true)}
        onMouseUp={() => setIsPressed(false)}
        onMouseLeave={() => setIsPressed(false)}
        {...props}
      >
fix.description: Add aria-label or aria-describedby for loading state and aria-disabled when loading
fix.content:
<Comp
        className={cn(
          baseClasses,
          variantClasses[variant],
          sizeClasses[size],
          isPressed && "scale-95",
          className,
        )}
        ref={ref}
        disabled={disabled || loading}
        aria-disabled={disabled || loading}
        aria-label={loading ? `Loading... ${children}` : undefined}
        onTouchStart={() => setIsPressed(true)}
        onTouchEnd={() => setIsPressed(false)}
        onMouseDown={() => !isMobile && setIsPressed(true)}
        onMouseUp={() => setIsPressed(false)}
        onMouseLeave={() => setIsPressed(false)}
        {...props}
      >

          }
        }}

        onDragLeave={handleDragLeave}
        onDragOver={handleDragOver}
        onDrop={handleDrop}
        role="button"
        tabIndex={0}
        onKeyDown={(e) => {

    className={cn("animate-spin", className)}
    fill="none"
    viewBox="0 0 24 24"
    aria-hidden="true"
  >
    <circle
      className="opacity-25"
      cx="12"
      cy="12"
      r="10"
      stroke="currentColor"
      strokeWidth="4"
    />
    <path
      className="opacity-75"
      fill="currentColor"
      d="m4 12a8 8 0 018-8V0C5.373 0 0 5.373 0 12h4zm2 5.291A7.962 7.962 0 014 12H0c0 3.042 1.135 5.824 3 7.938l3-2.647z"
    />
  </svg>
);

fix.content:
const LoadingSpinner = ({ className }: { className?: string }) => (
  <svg
    className={cn("animate-spin", className)}
    fill="none"
    viewBox="0 0 24 24"
    aria-hidden="true"
  >
    <circle
      className="opacity-25"
      cx="12"
      cy="12"
      r="10"
      stroke="currentColor"
      strokeWidth="4"
    />
    <path
      className="opacity-75"
      fill="currentColor"
      d="m4 12a8 8 0 018-8V0C5.373 0 0 5.373 0 12h4zm2 5.291A7.962 7.962 0 014 12H0c0 3.042 1.135 5.824 3 7.938l3-2.647z"

issues.message: Home button should have better accessibility support with keyboard navigation
issues.description: Home button should have better accessibility support with keyboard navigation This code works but could be improved for better maintainability.
issues.suggestion: Add tabIndex and onKeyDown handler for proper keyboard accessibility

fix.newCode:
<motion.button
                    type="button"
                    whileHover={{ scale: 1.05 }}
                    whileTap={{ scale: 0.95 }}
                    onClick={onHomeClick}
                    tabIndex={0}
                    onKeyDown={(e) => {
                      if (e.key === 'Enter' || e.key === ' ') {
                        e.preventDefault();
                        onHomeClick?.();
                      }
                    }}
                    className={cn(
                      breadcrumbItemVariants({
                        isActive: "false",
                        isClickable: "true",
                      }),
                    )}
                    aria-label="Home"
                  >
                    <Home className="h-4 w-4" />
                  </motion.button>
fix.description: Add tabIndex and onKeyDown handler for proper keyboard accessibility
fix.content:
<motion.button
                    type="button"
                    whileHover={{ scale: 1.05 }}
                    whileTap={{ scale: 0.95 }}
                    onClick={onHomeClick}
                    tabIndex={0}
                    onKeyDown={(e) => {
                      if (e.key === 'Enter' || e.key === ' ') {
                        e.preventDefault();
                        onHomeClick?.();
                      }
                    }}
                    className={cn(
                      breadcrumbItemVariants({
                        isActive: "false",
                        isClickable: "true",
                      }),
                    )}

                  >

issues.message: Alert component should include aria-live attribute for screen reader announcements
issues.description: Alert component should include aria-live attribute for screen reader announcements This code works but could be improved for better maintainability.
issues.suggestion: Add aria-live='polite' or aria-live='assertive' based on alert urgency to ensure screen readers announce the alert content

fix.newCode:
<div
        ref={ref}
        role="alert"
        aria-live={variant === "error" ? "assertive" : "polite"}
        className={cn(
          "liquid-glass-effect rounded-lg border p-4",
          "backdrop-blur-md backdrop-saturate-150",
          variantStyles[variant],
          className,
        )}
        {...props}
      >
